WORKOUT STEPS 1
Effective Home Workouts for fast muscle building without eqipment.
FITWORK application makes you go beyond what you think as your body muscles grow and more flexible not like before.
Focuses on 6 major muscle groups:
--> Abs Workout
--> Shoulder and Back Workout
--> Leg Workout
--> Arm and Chest Workout
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and your arms stretched forward.
2. Exhale and lift your upper body, keeping your head and neck relaxed.
Abdominal crunches are designed to tone the core muscles of the body.
Lie on the floor with your hands behind your ears. Raise your knees and close your right elbow toward your left knee, then close yourleft elbow toward your right knee. Repeat the exercise.
This exercise works your abs and obliques and because it keeps your body moving constantly, boosts your heart rate and burns even more calories.
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and your hands behind your ears.
2. Raise and twist your torso so your right elbow moves to meet your left knee. Repeat with the other side.
The cross crunch targets both abs and the oblique muscles. This exercise helps to strengthen the core, sculpts the waist.
1. Liew down on your back, and put your hands beneath your hips for support.
2. Then lift your legs up until the form a right angle with the floor.
3. Slowly bring your legs back down and repeat the exercise.
Tones, strengthens muscles in your adbomen and legs.
Start in the push-up position. Bend your right knee towards your chest and keep your left leg straight, then quickly switch from one leg to another.
This exercise are great for building cardio endurance, core strength, and agility.
1. Lie on your stomach with your arms to your sides.
2. Lift your arms up and extend them over your head to touch your thumbs. Then slowly bring them back. Repeat the exercise.
1. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Put your hands beneath your shoulders with your fingers pointing toward your hips.
2. Lift your hips off the floor. Then bend and extend your elbows to lower and lift your hips.
This exercise works almost all of the upper body muscles as it strengthens as muscles in the shoulder, chest as well as triceps.
1. Start with your hands and feet on the floor. Put your hands shoulder width apart. Bend your body, and fit your hips up in an upside down V shape.
2. Bend your elbows, and bring your head close to the floor. Push your body back, and repeat the exercise.
This exercise works your shoulders, arms, chest, back and core, and helps to tone and strengthen your entire upper body.
1. Lie down on your stomach with your toes touching the floor, and your chin on your hand.
2. Raise your chest up as high as possible off the floor. Hold this position for a few seconds and then go back to the start position. Repeat the exercise.
This exercise also contribute, in part, in developing and strengthening your body core.
1. Lie on your back with your feet on the floor and your arms bent on two sides.
2. Push your chest up as far as you can, and then slowly go back to the start position. Repeat the exercise.
This exercise is beneficial for building upper body strength.
1. Lay prone on the ground with arms supporting your body.
2. Keep your body straight while raising and lowering your body with your arms.
Increase Testosterone and reduce Osteoporosis Development.
1. Start in the regular push-up position but with your hands spread wider than your shoulders.
2. Then push your body up and down. Remember to keep your body straight.
Prevent lower back injuries.
1. Start on all fours with your knees under your butt and your hand under your shoulders.
2. Then elevate your feet on a chair or bench, and push your body up and down mainly using your arm strength. Remember to keep your body srtaight.
Enhance your Cardiovascular System
1. Start on all fours with your knees under your butt and your hand under your shoulders.
2. Make a diamond shape with your forefingers and thumbs together directly under your face, then push your body up and down.
Improve your posture.
1. Start with your hands and feet touching the floor, body bent and butt up in an upside down V shape.
2. Then bend your elbows to bring your body towards the floor. When your body is close to the floor, raise your upper body as fas as possible. then return to the original position and repeat.
Prevent lower back injuries.
1. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart and your arms stretched forward, then lower your body until your thighs are parallel with the floor.
2. Your knees should be extended in the same direction as your toes. And return to the start position.
Reduces the risk of injury.
1. Start with your hands on your hips and feet a little wider than shoulder width apart.
2. Then lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
3. Your knees should be extended in the same direction as your tiptoes.
Strenghtens your core.
1. Start with your feet shoulder width aprt and your hands on your hips.
2. Step a big step backward with your right leg and lower your body until your left thigh is parallel to the floor. Return and repeat with the other side.
This exercise helps in achieving proper body balance and coordination.
1. Starts in the squat position, then jump up using abdonimal muscles for strength.
This exercise strengthening your lower body and core muscles, burning calories and fat, toning your butt and legs, improving balance and agility, and ultimately, helping you lose weight.
1. Stand straight up. Then step back with your left leg to the right, and bend your knees at the same time.
2. Go back to the position and switch to the other side.
Stronger legs and Glutes.
